intro: Katoutheka, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a yellow center. Katoutheka typically grows in grasslands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
